WorkItem.ClosedComment: User Misconception, clarification methods have been implemented since to help with this
WorkItem.Description: This belt, which drops in 25m Coliseum, has one blue gem slot. Rawr shows it with three (including the one from the belt buckle), so there's an extra slot being added.

Comments.Message: Why is this a Rawr issue? Do you have the latest Wowhead/Armory data? Is it wrong?

Wowhead lists it as having one blue socket. 

Armory actually has two listings. One (46973) is ilvl 258, with both blue and red sockets, and one (46972) is ilvl 245, with one blue (the actual one). 

Incidentally, I gave the name wrong. It should be "Mist" (singular).
OK, then what's the problem? Rawr correctly loads them both for me, and they're already a part of the default data in v2.2.12.

Okay, apparently it's an Armory thing then. I didn't expect to see two items with exactly the same name. My guess is that there was originally one item, the ilvl 258 one, and they split it into two, because there's also a Belt of the Tenebrous Mist that has the same exact stats and slots as the ilvl 258. 

One remaining thing seems to be wrong in Rawr. It says the ilvl 245 version drops in 10m Trial of the Crusader, but even on the Armory it says it drops in 25m.

Err, no, there really are two items with the same name. Almost all of the 258 items are duplicates of 245 items with boosted stats/sockets.
245 items drop in both 10man heroic and 25man normal.
Okay, sorry for the false alarm then. You have to admit, it's confusing though. It's hard to select the right item in Rawr when there are two items with the same name. Blame Blizzard.
